body:
Regarding the failure: maybe this can help https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22489398/unsupported-major-minor-version-52-0

If we can still fix it soon I'd suggest let's upgrade to 5.4.5 in one PR?

@guozhangwang there seems to be a new RocksDB release every month. I don't know why we can't move ahead with this and then pick up the next one as we go. It's not the unsupported major-minor version problem, it's a reference check inside the RocksDB's deallocator that's giving the current problem: https://github.com/facebook/rocksdb/issues/2533 cc @dguy

Hello, @guozhangwang, @dguy  
can you please review this PR.

Bests,

Fix for the failure of tearDown after `kafka.api.ConsumerBounceTest.testCloseDuringRebalance`  in https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-trunk-jdk8/1780/:

```
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException: KafkaConsumer is not safe for multi-threaded access
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.acquire(KafkaConsumer.java:1691)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.close(KafkaConsumer.java:1585)
	at org.apache.kafka.clients.consumer.KafkaConsumer.close(KafkaConsumer.java:1565)
	at kafka.api.IntegrationTestHarness.$anonfun$tearDown$2(IntegrationTestHarness.scala:99)
	at kafka.api.IntegrationTestHarness.$anonfun$tearDown$2$adapted(IntegrationTestHarness.scala:99)
```
@hachikuji Can you review, please? Thank you...

@miguno @enothereska @guozhangwang @mjsax @bbejeck - this is mostly c&p from the confluent docs, with formatting etc.
Is there any specific way we link to code from the AK docs? i.e., so we don't need to change the version every time there is a release?

`kafkatest.tests.streams.streams_eos_test.StreamsEosTest.test_failure_and_recovery_complex: FAIL` same test failed again as usual.
Excellent, thanks @evis . cc @dguy @guozhangwang . LGTM
I wish all unit tests caught all problems. I find it useful to kick a system test in the background. Just to make it clear: I don't mean all system tests, just `kafkatest/tests/streams/`
@dguy thanks ! Now I can work on another proposal related to logging.
I believe @enothereska is suggesting that we run the system tests, not write a new one.
@mjsax any news about merging this already approved PR ?
@dguy there were cases when a test didn't need a `throws Exception` at all. Other cases it's clearer IMO if we enumerate exactly what exceptions a rest throws, rather than the generic Exception.

> I've left one comment. I think the only other thing remaining is whether or not we should implement the pattern for setting state.

Thanks @dguy I'm not sure what this refers to. I looked back but I don't see @guozhangwang 's comment. Could you elaborate? Thanks.

This seems to be a duplicate: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/3415

@hachikuji It seems that Kafka  dose not introduce any mock framework such as mockito.
So without mock framework, could you give me any advice to write such a unit test?
@vahidhashemian indeed it is.
@dongeforever You can use `easymock/powermock` for the unit tests. There are already tests in `clients` which use these.

Hmm, do we care which exceptions a test throws though? Note that it doesn't affect the behaviour of the test.
I do agree that we should remove the throws clause if unnecessary since it's just noise. But enumerating every possible exception seems like overkill.
@guozhangwang @ijuma Any conclusion about this? I can also just close the PR as we leave as-is. Or should we log as error and rethrow? From a user point of view, do people want to fail for this case?

Ah. "do a test" sounded like adding a new test.
Did trigger https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder/951/
Thanks @guozhangwang updated
I can't merge anything. I am not a committer. \cc @guozhangwang @dguy

https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/5889/

@enothereska Can you elaborate the benefit of enumerating the exceptions though? The reason I'm asking is that once you merge this PR, then all future PRs will be influenced by the style in the code. And it's good to have a shared understanding when it comes to that kind of thing.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed):

Test FAILed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.11).
@ijuma Thank you for the review. I will merge it since it occasionally causes test failures. If @hachikuji has any suggestions, I will do it as a separate PR.

@dguy @mjsax Regarding links to code, we have a `dotVersion` variable under `js/templateData.js` for that, usage example can be found here:

https://github.com/apache/kafka-site/blob/asf-site/0110/quickstart.html#L285
But currently we do not have examples for IQ in apache kafka repo, so I will merge this PR as is and we can add the links when we have those under examples folder.
Merged to trunk. @dguy Could you file another PR for `kafka-site` repo as well for 0110 folder so it can be reflected as well?

If we change the behavior to throw, do we need a proper JIRA?

Failed with
> java.lang.AssertionError: Condition not met within timeout 30000. wait for agg to be '123'
>	at org.apache.kafka.test.TestUtils.waitForCondition(TestUtils.java:274)
>	at org.apache.kafka.streams.integration.QueryableStateIntegrationTest.shouldAllowToQueryAfterThreadDied(QueryableStateIntegrationTest.java:793)

\cc @enothereska
Retest this please.

Yeah we can create a JIRA for it.

On Wed, Jul 5, 2017 at 5:42 PM, Matthias J. Sax <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> If we change the behavior to throw, do we need a proper JIRA?
>
> —

> .
>



-- 
-- Guozhang
